metadata.title: CVE-2023-23920 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An untrusted search path vulnerability exists in Node.js. <19.6.1,<18.14.1, <16.19.1, and <14.21.3 that could allow an attacker to search andpotentially load ICU data when running with elevated privileges.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23920` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode108 - 18.19.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4
nodejs - 18.19.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '18.19.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4').
